title: Phil Foden son Ronnie , 5 , enjoys puppy yoga in Manchester in sweet snaps as his father prepares for England crucial Euro 2024 clash against Slovenia
body_text:
Phil Foden is gearing up for England's make-or-break clash with Slovenia in Germany tomorrow.
But back in Manchester, his young son Ronnie was relaxing with a trip to a 'doggy yoga' studio ahead of his father's turn on the football pitch.
Wearing an England football shirt in support of the Manchester City midfielder, the five-year-old attended a session at Puppy Yoga Manchester, where he got to play with some adorable dogs while trying out some yoga moves.
The eldest child of the footballer, 24, and partner Rebecca Cooke, 22, has become a social media sensation and already has a staggering four million followers on Instagram.
Photos posted by the studio show Ronnie grinning as he pets the puppies alongside his mother.
Phil Foden's son Ronnie, five, relaxing with a trip to a 'doggy yoga' studio in Manchester, ahead of his father's crucial make-or-break clash with England at Euro 2024
The sportsman will take to the pitch with the Three Lions on Tuesday for their final group match against Slovenia, after a lacklustre performance against Denmark last week
Wearing an England football shirt in support of the Manchester City midfielder, the five-year-old attended a session at Puppy Yoga Manchester
'We hosted the cutest private event for Ronnie Foden and his family last weekend,' the studio wrote on Instagram.
'Whilst our public events are 11+, younger children are always welcome at smaller private events, providing the correct adult: children ratio.'
The studio describes itself as being, 'a unique experience that combines mindfulness with animal therapy to improve mental health and wellbeing.'
The youngster became something of an overnight social media sensation last year after finding himself the subject of an internet meme that went viral.
Following Manchester City's Champions League triumph over Inter Milan in Istanbul, Ronnie was dubbed 'El Wey' or 'The Dude' when a photo of him on the football pitch did the rounds online.
He also had a selfie with Erling Haaland in the dressing room and was on Foden's shoulders when Jack Grealish led a singalong for Rodri to 90s dance classic Freed from Desire by Gala in a clip that was posted online.
His parents then set up a social media account for him, which amassed an impressive one million followers in just 14 hours.
The eldest child of the footballer, 24, and partner Rebecca Cooke, 22, has become a social media sensation and already has a staggering four million followers on Instagram
Photos posted by the studio show Ronnie grinning as he pets the puppies alongside his mother
The studio describes itself as being, 'a unique experience that combines mindfulness with animal therapy to improve mental health and wellbeing'
'His personality has made him who he is. I think he went quite viral after [we] won the Champions League. He just reminds me of myself when I was a kid and he's very funny,' Foden told Sky Sports News at the time.
'I couldn't believe it. Every comment on my social media page was asking to see him. So I thought I'd give the fans what they wanted and create an account for him and it just blew up.'
Despite only being five, Ronnie is already represented by Propel Talent Group and has landed collaborations with brands.
Ms Cooke, who gave birth to Ronnie when she was 18, is currently pregnant with the couple's third child, announcing the news with a lavish baby shower back in April.
The childhood sweethearts are also parents to two-year-old daughter True and the family live in a Â£2.85 million six-bed mansion in the Cheshire village of Prestbury.
